reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
reviews.text: A suitably surreal place to stay when in Tokyo. Of course, all the communal areas are straight from "that film" and you'll enjoy fabulous views whichever room you take. Even the "basic" Park King comes with a gorgeous bathroom, DVD player, selection of CDs and, inevitably, some Suntory whisky in the minibar.

likes.disliked: — Pool area a bit too minimalist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had 24 hours here and so made the most of the hotel. They do a great afternoon tea in the 41st floor Peak Lounge and, inevitably, we had dinner in the New York Grill. The food was superb (particularly the unforgettable Kobe beef) and there was an extensive, if perhaps California-centric, wine list. The restaurant certainly seemed very American in that there were few diners after 9pm.
reviews.title: Lived up to all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had no complaints about the excellent personalised hotel service, with the possible exception of the swimming pool area where a slightly frosty reception awaits. What's more, the pool itself is a very functional lap pool and, despite the amazing views, isn't somewhere you'll want to lounge around.
reviews.title: A sight for sore eyes!

likes.disliked: — Food at The New York Grill isn't as good as it should be - be warned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It isn't cheap (and dinner in the New York Grill cost more than the room) but if you need to stay in Shinjuku there's nowhere better.
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Park Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Well after 2 weeks of backpacking around Vietnam and 2 weeks of staying in traditional Japanese inns in both Tokyo and Kyoto my wife and I thought that staying at The Park Hyatt over NYE would be a great way to finish off our honeymoon... needless to say we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Prefer the Mandarin Oriental or the Grand Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004
reviews.text: this hotel is pricey but definitely worth it. Everything about it is luxurious, gorgeous room, very comfortable and the most amazing bathroom I've ever seen. There is a gym and a pool in the hotel and the piano upstairs which has great views of Tokyo and appeared in the film Lost in Translation. Would definitely recommend this for a special occasion or for a treat!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: This hotel is famed to be the best in Tokyo. It certainly has the best views right over the city and is very luxurious. The rooms are great, really large and clean. The bathroom has many, many mirrors so the vain among you can admire yourselves until your heart's content.
reviews.title: Great Building and view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The New York Grill restaurant on the 52nd floor had terrible service, very slow and not keen to take an order. The food was average, massively overpriced, even given the location. I was a little annoyed at having to pay a cover charge to sit in the bar and have a drink, even though I was a resident, I found that quite rude!
reviews.title: Great hotel, but definitely not for small children / is not child friendly

likes.liked: — Clean, well maintained, excellent facilities in the room including an enormous plasma TV and an impressive hot tub...!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall I had a good stay at this hotel. The service was a little impersonal and you kind of felt that you were interrupting people asking for something but the location and view is amazing.
reviews.title: Marvellous Hotel

likes.liked: — Hard to pin point one thing, so i'll say everything.
likes.disliked: — Absolutely nothing atall. The Hotel was sublime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is undoubtedly a lovely hotel in a great location, with fantastic views and excellent service, but was also a huge disappointment in one respect for us.
reviews.title: always perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A six-night stay at the hotel was something we had looked forward to for several months - reading several reviews on Trip Advisor in advance simply whetted our appetite.
reviews.title: A haven within the urban jungle of Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to Japan several times I was aware of the expected levels of service and was not disappointed at the Park Hyatt Tokyo. From stepping out at the front door to leaving after 6 nights the staff were exemplary - never intrusive and extremely helpful. It makes staying at any hotel in the west see simply awful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being taken up to reception and then our room we were simply amazed by the view, the comfort and the bathroom. Despite some serious jet lag we could not wait to explore the hotel and its amenities. The pool on the 47th floor is simply wonderful - swimming with TOkyo stretched out beneath you is surreal. The bar, although expensive, was worth it for the treat. Given the exchange rate for the Yen at the moment it was not too bad. Breakfast and other meals were always fabulous.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we were out and about most of the time it was always a joy to come back to the comfort and reassurance of the hotel. I felt like the staff were our friends at the end.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel... but something is missing...

likes.liked: — Service, views from the room, 5-star comfort.
likes.disliked: — Expensive, crowded public spaces, lack of atmospheric charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I agree with everything Ian07 says about this fabulous hotel where service and physicals are spot on. I stayed at the hotel for one night last September and so enjoyed the experience that I am returning next week for 4 nights. Personally I do not find the location a problem, Sinjuko station is a great hub and so easy to get to anywhere in the city including Narita. The limo bus to/from Narita also stops at the hotel. The hotel is very convenient for Opera City and all the various musical offerings.
reviews.title: Stunning Park Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are glad that we stayed at the famous Shinjuku Park Hyatt, but we will certainly never stay there again.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

likes.liked: — The room, the bathroom, the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Check-in was smooth and the staff were professional. However, the positive encounters with the staff ended there. The staff the hotel has dotted around are clearly there to keep the "riff-raff" out rather than provide good service to their guests. We live in Japan, and I myself have lived in the Tokyo metro area so we are keenly aware of how important appearances are. We were certainly not sloppily dressed while in the hotel. Despite that, we are not celebrities, so the staff stationed at the doors and elevators basically gave us the "you're not a star so state your business!" treatment. We had to tell the staff far too many times (even once is too many!) that we were guests. One night, I went to bar/lounge for a drink by myself, and the service was terrible. The same night my husband went with his friends to the same bar and they also were fed up with the service.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The New York Grill must be one of the most over-hyped restaurants in Tokyo. As we exited the elevator on the floor the NYG is on in our swankiest attire, a girl practically ran toward us asking if we had a reservation (this was not at all an example of prompt Japanese service). She seemed doubtful when we said yes. Our waiter was too young and inexperienced to be working at a place like that. My husband's dish was very good, mine merely average. The prices were completely outrageous - we've eaten in restaurants in Tokyo that were just as nice as NYG and had better food for less money. Of course, those places didn't have that great view. At any rate, the presence of women who were clearly escorts with their middle-aged patrons gave the place a sleazy feel. (The sleazy feel was intensified the next morning when I left the hotel early and saw a woman leaving hurriedly who was clearly in the escort-type clothes she had on the night before).
reviews.title: As good as expected...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the room was huge and beautiful, and the bathroom was stunning. But the lousy service and the mix of Tokyo and Hollywood-type sleaze will keep up away.
reviews.title: A bit pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Best advice I can give - If you can spend $500 a night on a hotel room, stay at the Four Seasons in Marunouchi.
reviews.title: Average for Park Hyatt

likes.disliked: — Room decor, hotel needs updating as it is already 10+ yrs old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had to be virtually dragged out of the Park Hyatt Tokyo, kicking and screaming, I could quite happily taken up residence there for quite some time. It is quite simply impeccable- the decor, the service- the attention to every detail is amazing and yet never intrusive- how very Japanese.
reviews.title: my absolute new favourite hotel

likes.liked: — the room, the view, the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, on the 47th floor, was a zen paradise of tranquil colours,fantastically organised space and amazing bathroom- yes, the toilet is quite incredible.They have an amazingly impressive mini bar too and .... they also have amazing coffee and tea making facilities-I give extra points to any hotel that provides a kettle in the room, so that you can actually make your first cup of coffee without waiting around and dealing with the fuss of room service first thing in the morning.The view is astonishing.
reviews.title: You're just too good to be true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The common areas are astonishing too, the restaurants, the reception and library area-it was just so easy and beautiful and calm,we had come from Europe, spent two days in New York - so already pretty jet lagged, then flown 14 hours from Washington - with the jet lag associated with that -by the time we got to Tokyo, we weren't sure which way was up, this is a very soft place to land, if you feel like that !
reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the New York Grill the first night- the service was great, but to be honest, I was so jetlagged the food didn't really register ! Then at Kozue- the Japanese restaurant- which was great and then at Girandole, for breakfast and also a couple of lunches- wonderful view and wonderful people watching!
reviews.title: An unmemorable stay

likes.liked: — The views from the top were okay
likes.disliked: — The attitude problem of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and gym are amazing - underneath a glass atrium overlooking the whole of Tokyo - it is an experience to use them!
reviews.title: Absolutely top class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The swimmingpool area is stunning and thankfully there was very few people hanging around there.
reviews.title: Park Hyatt one of the best

likes.liked: — Attitude of the staff was outstanding and the hotel was very accommodating to us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: At $600 a night, I expected more, particularly in the service department. Although I had requested an early check-in and arrived several hours later than foreseen, my room was not ready when I arrived at 3 pm. As it faced a six-lane motorway, it was not exactly quiet either, despite being located on a high floor. The location of the hotel is not all that great either unless you are a slot machine addict and Pachinkos (the Japanese version of gambling) are your thing. The hotel uses old-style real room keys, so fitting them in the correct hole in the dimly lit corridors after a night out can be a challenge. While I thought the electronic music channel in the hotel room was very nice, this alone does not justify the exorbitant price and the zero service. The TV has only American and Japanese channels, so French, German or Spanish guests have no chance of catching up with what's going on at home. By all means, go and enjoy the spectacular views by having a drink or a meal at the hotel but when you go to Tokyo stay at a hotel that is worth its price.
reviews.title: Terribly overrated!

likes.disliked: — Lack of client orientation and unsolicited sales talk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I splurged for one night at the Park Hyatt and it was worth every penny! We were blown away by everything..the minimalism, the service, the views...everything. We did not want to leave. They knew my name when I got out of the cab, which was wild, and the intro/check in/walk through was very cool indeed! Room was spacious with giant TV and bathroom. The mirrors even made you look better! Breakfast in bed was delicious and elegant. I can't go into everything in detail, but EVERYTHING was great! Want to go back ASAP!
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Park Hyatt for 4 nights at the end of September and it far exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in
World's Best.
reviews.text: This has to be one of the best hotels ever. The rooms are wonderful, even our standard room was bigger than expected, the beds are so comfortable, the bathroom was amazing, with the deepest bath I have ever seen, and the views from our room over the city and Yoyogi Park to the Olympic Stadium were mesmerising.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in all of the hotels 3 restaurants, and yes they were expensive, but the food and the service were second to none - the old saying 'you get what you pay for' is certainly true here.
reviews.title: One of the best hotel in Tokyo !

likes.liked: — The room, the decoration and the restaurants !
